abstract: Editorial highlights absurdity of Republican efforts to paint Consumer Financial Protection Bureau as unaccountable rogue agency, even in wake of bureau uncovering fraudulent practices at Wells Fargo; notes investigation into bank has resulted in $100 million penalty for institution; points to legislation passed by Republicans in House designed to cripple agency as indication of what they will do should Donald Trump win presidency.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: A robust consumer protection bureau is needed to protect the public from unfair, deceptive and abusive practices.
snippet: A robust consumer protection bureau is needed to protect the public from unfair, deceptive and abusive practices....

headline.main: Bashing the Hero in the Wells Fargo Case
headline.print_headline: Bashing the Hero in Wells Fargo Case
